Local artists show crafts

Displaying art is important because it exposes different perceptions and the artist to the community Director of the HUB galleries and Craft Centre Denise Arieu said PERIOD  an exhibit which opens today in the HUB Art Alley gives Centre region craftspeople an opportunity to present their work in a University setting PERIOD

exhibit preview The exhibit is a multimedia collection of works by the members of the Central Pennsylvania Guild of Craftsmen PERIOD Some artists in the group show their artworks nationally many have won awards PERIOD

 Arieu said PERIOD  is composed of both decorative and functional work made from wood clay metal fabric and batique PERIOD  Arieu stated PERIOD

There is everything from ceramics and jewelry to quilts and clothing Sylvia Apple Chairwoman of the  exhibit committee said PERIOD  she pointed out PERIOD 

Apple who works with fabric and creates quilts will be one of the many artists displaying her work PERIOD Other artists whose work will be presented include Vonny Boarts Brian Galas and Roy Bohn woodwork Annelise Deering and Joan Horrocks clay and ceramics Antoinette Holl Linda Brainard and Connie Schroeder fabrics and Helen Newhard clay and metals PERIOD Newhard will also be presenting a lunchtime lecture  this Wednesday at  p.m PERIOD in the HUB Browsing Gallery PERIOD Her talk in conjunction with the exhibit will discuss shaping coloring and adding texture to sunfaces such as metal and clay PERIOD

The exhibit continues through March  in the Art Alley of the HUB which is open from  a.m PERIOD to  a.m PERIOD Monday through Sunday PERIOD Many of the pieces displayed will also be for sale PERIOD  Apple said PERIOD
